website_summaries.verdict: This 2-pack includes Optimus Prime and Orion Pax. A great value for two figures with good detail and quality.
pros: Excellent detail and articulation make these figures true to the characters
Orion Pax has ingenious design that uses legs to make entire side of the vehicle
cons: Consumers report that a few figures had loose joints

customer_reviews.title: Old and New in a Pack of Two
customer_reviews.text: A fantastic set. Orion Pax's conversion to truck mode and back is both simple and ingenious in how the legs form the entire sides of the vehicle. Optimus Prime is a bit more complicated, but the instructions are very clear and made it easier to go through the motions. Articulation is great on both, colors are fantastic shades of red and blue with small hints of color, and it's just a nice tribute to Optimus Prime with two very different toys representing two very different points in his story.
customer_reviews.author: Louie Calisto

customer_reviews.title: Great set of figures
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent set of figures. The Optimus figure from "War for Cybertron" is really really good; although it has its flaws. It's a little sturdy and presents balance problems but the transformation is very neat. The Orion Pax figure is great, nice poseability, vibrant colors and the transformation is interesting but not difficult. The only to make this figure better would be by not making it a headmaster, other than that is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: paflopi

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Set.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing Set. I got lucky and was able to grab this set while in stock. The Optimus Prime action figure is one of the most detailed and difficult to transform of any Transformers figure that I have. The colors look amazing. The Orion Pax figure is much easier to transform and belongs with the Titans Return line, being a repaint of the Sergeant Kup figure. I would not get this box set for a younger fan. These are really for the bigger kids and the grown kids.
customer_reviews.author: Craig C

customer_reviews.title: More like "Optimally Frustrating Puzzle Robot From Hell" and his ill-conceived partner, "I'm-Really-Kup"
customer_reviews.text: This sucks. The Optimus Prime is impossible to transform without at least 2 months of training on Cybertron, and the Orion Pax is just a repaint of Kup and it looks nothing like Orion Pax. And his legs are dumb. The only reason to buy this is to have the complete Titans Return collection, repaints and rereleases and all.
customer_reviews.author: Vince Kramer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great set! Orion Pax is a great figure and ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great set! Orion Pax is a great figure and use of the Titans Return Kup mold. Optimus Prime is a slight repaint of one released several years ago. If you missed it the first time this is a great opportunity to pick it up. Pax's transformation is much simpler than Prime's. Both may be too complex for younger kids.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: For Older Fans
customer_reviews.text: I'm at fault for not reading the age range for this: one of these has 27 steps to go from robot to car, so if you want something for your desk it's fine, just don't give it to the young kids to play with.
customer_reviews.author: Gnex User

customer_reviews.title: Great Transformer Set
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loved this set he is 11 and really plays allot with them, The are also a nice size it was great to see that they are big and not just some little action figure. I was very impressed with the size and how they are packaged.
customer_reviews.author: Paulina

customer_reviews.title: Give these to kids you don't like.
customer_reviews.text: I grew up with the transformers. These are crap. They take an engineering degree and several hours to realize they don't fit and slide. Way too complicated for a kid - and not fun even if they weren't complicated. If I called these more of a logic puzzle, that would be an insult to logic.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Blank

customer_reviews.title: Awesome fingers
customer_reviews.text: The two figures are amazing I love that one of them is from the Titans return toy line and the other ones from War of Cybertron toyline the two awesome figures.

customer_reviews.title: Solid set at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: At $30, this is a solid set. It's a nice remold of Titans Return Kup into Orion Pax, and he's somewhat accurate to his cartoon look as well. The Optimus Prime is the WFC mold, and it still a pain to transform, but has nice paint job. It's a solid set, but not worth the $60-70+ some people are charging for it.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Kind of meh
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty hyped to own these figures. You can never have enough Optimus Prime figures. These both are repaints and reuses of previous molds. Somehow they feel more thin and cheaper. It was honestly very disappointing and I wound up selling this set to a friend. My star rating is so high because they aren't horrible toys but I personally lost interest after a while.
customer_reviews.author: TMan978

customer_reviews.title: Great despite 2 QC problems
customer_reviews.text: Its a great 2 pack. I have 2 complaints. The hips on orion pax were kind of lose. The optimus figure right shoulder wasnt molded correctly. Other then those 2 QC problems their great figures to added to my collection.

customer_reviews.title: The directions are difficult to comprehend, very confusing and that is from a dad's perspective how could a child folllow them!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 8yr old son for Christmas, I can't transform these two figures, I own several transformers from other companies and have never had as much issue as I am having with these two. My son is extremely disappointed with their function, they are difficult to transform and when in robot form do not stand. when your child says to you "why did you even waste your money on these they are junk I hate them" it makes for a sad Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Richard C

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed, cheaply made.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 6 year old nephew. I do think it’s a little hard for him to transform but he’ll learn. The reason I’m giving it a 2 Star is because the limbs pop off really easily. So his arms and legs pop off the small joint ball and will soon be too worn to stay on on robot.

product_meta.title: Transformers Deluxe Class Optimus Prime Autobot Legacy 2-Pack (Amazon Exclusive)
product_meta.description:
Experience the evolution of the iconic Transformers warrior, Optimus Prime, with this Autobot Legacy 2-figure pack that includes Optimus Prime and his pre-Prime identity, Orion Pax. Standing at a 5.25-inch-scale, these converting Deluxe Class figures are detailed with unique deco that make them one-of-a-kind collector figures.

“Fate rarely calls upon us at the moment of our choosing.” 
- Optimus Prime

Before Optimus Prime began combatting evil as the noble Autobot leader, he was Orion Pax, a humble data scientist. When Megatron led a Decepticon attack, the noble Autobot warrior accepted the Matrix of Leadership and became the universe’s greatest protector, guiding the Autobots with legendary wisdom and power. 

2016 Hasbro. All Rights Reserved. 
2016 Paramount Pictures Corporation. All Rights Reserved.
Transformers and all related characters are trademarks of Hasbro.
feature_bullets: Deluxe Class Optimus Prime Autobot Legacy 2-Pack
Both figures convert between robot and truck modes
Orion Pax figure converts in 18 steps
Optimus Prime figure converts in 27 steps
Includes Transformers Deluxe Class Optimus Prime and Orion Pax figures, blaster accessory, and instructions.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars139 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
